item.title: Engine idling during night time, 10th September
item.description:
A black Audi is often parked in Gayhurst Road with engine and lights running during bedtime. engine idling is illegal in UK and is a residential and quiet area. The driver is not a local for sure. Hackney please investigate!
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Gayhurst Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Severe obstruction of pavement, 10th September
item.description:
The florist daily obsructs the pavement with floral displays, pot plants and potted trees. This is a busy pavement and is reduced to single fie throughout trading hours. When staff or customers are standing by the display the pavement is completely obstructed. This area is not demised to the shop under its lease. The freeholder and manager of the unit is the City of London coporation, who are also the highway authority.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Goswell Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large tree branch fallen on pavement, 10th September
item.description:
Large tree branch has fallen from tree on pavement outside number 19 and 21 Daneswood Avenue, not known if cut or broken off. Too big for garden waste to collect. Has been there over a week.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Daneswood Avenue, Southend, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Parking issues in close - leading to poor surface, having to drive on the kerb, creating access issues, 10th September
item.description:
Severe parking issues in the close. I have to mount the kerb every time to get to my house and causing damage to kerb and vehicle. Creating access issues, cannot turn around the close and creating surface issues. Too many vehicles to one household and parking incorrectly around the close. People not using their drives to park.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Andrew Close, Crayford, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Removal of bin request, 10th September
item.description:
• Please give brief details of your complaint or compliment below: Once again the poo bin outside my house is overflowing! Poo bags have been left on the floor with poo smeared on the pavement. This morning i had to clear it once again from my drive way . The bin needs to be removed , there are plenty of parks for dogs owners to go to. • What action (if any) would you like us to take? Remove the bin

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chesham Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet
